intro: Cercocarpus parvifolius var. breviflorus, commonly known as the shortflower curlleaf buckthorn, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clustered, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, woody fruits called坚果 (nuts) that are typically dispersed by animals. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and sagebrush habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
